group_1.textRight: Here is the amount of money you can withdraw.
Yes, your mother had an unusually large insurance policy...
I believe she was concerned for you, her only@daughter's wellbeing.
She must have been a fine parent...
Well, this concludes my business here.

group_1.textCenter: ...I guess I should deal with mom's things...
After all, I'm moving in with my uncle@next week...
I wonder if I can sell these clothes.@They're nice, after all...
...I think this is what she wore to my@piano recital...
...I'll think about it later.
Hmm...? This is...
...A diary...? Mother-Daughter Journal...?

group_1.narration: OO/XX@The baby kicked my belly a lot today.@She must be in a hurry to get outside.@Be patient, okay?@I'll give you so much love.

OO/XX@They told me you were a breach baby,@coming out feet first. @You must have wanted to run around@as soon as possible.@Don't worry, you'll get better@with a little exercise.@Your mom'll do her best for you.
OO/XX@Hello, baby!@I want you to be swaddled in love,@So I named you after the symbol of@motherly love: the night crane.@The world is overflowing with@so much love, you know.
OO/XX@Stop the presses!@Today, Yozuru turned over in her crib for the first time!!@Now that she can move, her mom has@that much more to worry about.@Great stuff, bring on the worrying!
I began reading this mother-daughter journal,@which I'd never seen before.
In it were records of my mother and me,@from before I could remember.

OO/XX@Looks like we made someone at@Nursery School cry again today...@I guess one year old is a bit early for@Yozuru to go to Nursery School.@It's my fault as the mother.@Guess I'll go with her tomorrow and apologize.
OO/XX@Got called to Nursery School again today.@Maybe if I could look after her more@things would go better?@Sorry for being such a stupid mother.@Yozuru, it's not your fault.
According to the mother-daughter journal...
I was a bit rambunctious as a small child --@A bit irritable sometimes.
OO/XX@Your mother just quit her job today.@Now you won't have to go to Nursery School.@Your daddy says he'll work extra for me too,@so you can relax and be with me.

OO/XX@Your daddy says he's tired.@But he's still sending money, so don't you worry.@...I know there's stuff to worry about,@but your mom will give it her all.@I promise you'll never be looked down on@for having a "single parent".
To let me live normally, like the other children...

group_1.textCenter: ...Is that what it was...?

group_1.narration: Even after I got older,@it seems my mother continued the diary.
It contained her fears for my future,@and her regret and apologies@for letting those fears turn@into outbursts of strictness.
On the final page,@that portrait I'd drawn@and she'd ripped up that day,@was tucked inside.
It had been taped back together with care,@and by it were words of apology@and a sloppy portrait of me.

group_1.textCenter: I'm so sorry... Mom...

group_1.narration: All of it was my fault.
She loved me when I was irritable.@She shielded me from the eyes of those around us,@trying to give me a normal life@when our home was falling apart...
And all I did was take it for granted,@like nothing was wrong...
Of course, not everything she did was forgiveable.

group_1.textCenter: (Mom, you really were a fool...)
(A hopeless parent...)
(...So why is it...)
(...I want to see you so badly...?)
(To see you just once, to apologize and thank@you, and praise what you've done.)
(I'll really... never see you again, will I?)
(...No, I *can* see you!)

group_1.narration: I had a moment of clarity.@And in it, devised the best possible solution.

group_1.textCenter: All I have to do is die...!
I mean, everything was my fault from the start...!
How could I let my mother die...
...While I, the root of all evil, go on living?!
And when I die, I'll get to see my mother in Hell...!
I can apologize there.
When I'm dead, it'll be so easy to make amends...!
She'll be at peace...!@Everything solved all at once!
Hi there, Sasame Yozuru.@Pleased to meet you.

group_1.narration: I had the perfect plan at the perfect time@when Kyuubey appeared.

group_1.textRight: Sure, I can even bring back someone you've@lost from the dead.

group_1.textLeft: But there are things that can't be fixed@just by coming back to life...
...What about the other way around:@can you kill someone I hate?

group_1.textRight: And far more certainly and effectively than@human means could, I would say.

group_1.narration: And so I wished...

group_1.textLeft: I want to die, right now.
I want peace in death so much I can barely@stand it.
I want to die and make amends.
So what I want you to do to me is...
...make me so I can go on living.

group_1.narration: [textRed:DON'T THINK YOU CAN ATONE THAT EASILY]
My means to an easy death was right before my eyes,
But to die as an attempt to apologize to my mother...
...Would be cowardice, not any sort of penitance.
I mustn't forgive myself, no matter what.
I am the Night Crane, bearing@a full measure of her mother's love.
And so I must live on.
...So cried out the innermost me...
And so I wished not for death... but for life.

group_1.textCenter: So that's your wish?
I see. True, you do seem liable to die at@any moment.

group_1.narration: I must have been crushed under so much guilt@that I was wavering between life and death...
And the result of my wish:@The loss of the guilt that sought to end my own life.
And instead of killing the whole of myself,
I killed only that part that is "gentleness".@And lived on.

group_1.textRight: Plenty'a Magical Girls contracted under@heavy wishes can't fight.
Right. That's why we chose to live as Coordinators.
But you're missin' the ability to pick up@on an emotion all Coordinators need.

group_1.textLeft: ...It'll take more than that to make me drop@dead, though.
My mother trained me better than that.
It is. Now that my life has been saved,@I intend to live it to the very fullest.

group_1.narration: And so, at the summit of the freedom and@blessings I grasped...

group_1.textCenter: I intend... to go on living.
